glsa.title: OpenJPEG: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability in OpenJPEG could result in execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 library.

description.p: An error in jp2.c of OpenJPEG could allow an out-of-bounds write error.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JPEG file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All OpenJPEG users should upgrade to the latest version:
